page.title: 01Introduction:rural parishes
page.content: This block takes in large sections of three parishes: Acton Beauchamp, Stanford Bishop, and Suckley, a small part of Cradley,and also small sections of land without houses in Evesbatch and Bishops Frome. The popu- lation is roughly 170 adults living in 80 houses. Much of the area lies along a ridge which looks south-east to the Malvern Hills, south to May Hill, west to the Black Mountains, and north to Bromyard Downs, Abberley Hills, and the hills of south Shropshire. The area contains many trees but few woods, the fields are comparatively small and most hedges remain in place. There are no villages and only one hamlet of nine houses at Acton Green. It is very quiet except when the peace is shattered by aircraft flying very low over the chimney tops.
